data.title: Fellows Archive
data.text:
Lieutenant General (Retired) Robert Baxter

Retired from the Armed Forces as a Lieutenant General. Operational service in Northern Ireland, Balkans, West Africa and the Gulf. Main activity delivering communications and information systems along with electronic warfare support. Awarded CBE whilst commanding in the Balkans. Staff appointments included Chief of Staff of an armoured brigade; instructing on command and leadership; education…

Professor Sir David Baulcombe

Professor Sir David Baulcombe is a plant molecular biologist whose research focuses on how plants protect themselves against viral disease. His research led to the discovery and characterisation of the “RNA silencing” system which is present in plants and animals and has diverse roles beyond protection against disease. This research has stimulated research in biotechnology…

Professor David Bates

Dr Bates is an internationally-renowned expert in health information technology, patient safety, and quality. His work has focused on improving clinical decision making, patient safety, quality-of-care, and cost effectiveness. He is Chief of the Division of General Internal Medicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital in Boston, a Professor of Medicine at Harvard Medical School, and…

Professor David Batty

David Batty is a Professor of Epidemiology at University College London (2017-), Visiting Professor at the Universities of Edinburgh and Glasgow (2009-), and a former Wellcome Trust Fellow (2004-12). An aetiological epidemiologist, the objective of his research is to understand how behavioural, psycho-social, and biological factors across the life course and between generations influence the…

Professor Michael Barrett

Alongside his role as Professor, Professor Michael Barrett is the Director of Glasgow Polyomics and a member of the Wellcome Trust Centre for Molecular Parasitology at the University of Glasgow. Michael is interested in microbial biochemistry with a view to understanding how antimicrobial drugs work and how microbes become resistant to drugs. He became interested…

Professor Christopher Barratt

I am working on male reproductive health. This involves examining factors which contribute to infertility (inability to have children) and specifically finding out how sperm cells are produced, how they work and what makes them go wrong. Men produce up to 1000 sperm in a heartbeat so it is a complicated process to study! In…
